subtitle: Stay away from smoky places
title: Why am I breathless?
content:
Created by BabyCenter


Even if you have never felt breathless before, like lots of women, you may sometimes feel breathless now. This is normal. Your body is adapting to being pregnant.

You can help your breathing by keeping away from dirty air and smoky places.

Do you chew tobacco or smoke a pipe? Stop, or cut down now. It is bad for you and your baby’s health.

Ask your family to smoke outside. If your house is smoky, open doors and windows. 

You can reduce smoke when you cook:

•	Use a charcoal stove if possible.

•	Use a lid. The pot can conserve heat and you can reduce cooking time, and so breathe in less 
smoke.

•	Soak food, especially dry food like beans, before cooking to reduce cooking time.

•	When cooking, spend as little time as possible in the kitchen. You could sit outside and only enter to check on the fire and food. Ask someone to help with blowing the fire if possible

•	Mopping can reduce the amount of dust you breathe in.

If you are breathless all the time, you may be anaemic. This means your body lacks iron. Taking iron tablets will help. You can also make sure you eat a variety of different foods like leafy vegetables, eggs, fruit, poultry, meat and offal. They all help your body to get iron.
